questions.question: Which ancient ruin site in the Andes was rediscovered in 1911, known for its intricately carved stone structures and terraced fields?
questions.context: This site, often referred to as the "Lost City of the Incas," is a popular destination for hikers and historians alike.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, completed in 2010 in Asia, holds the title of the tallest building in the world?
questions.context: Standing at a staggering 828 meters, this skyscraper symbolizes the rapid development of the city in the 21st century.

questions.question: What is the historic battle site in Belgium where Napoleon Bonaparte faced defeat in 1815, marking the end of his rule as Emperor of the French?
questions.context: Situated in the Walloon region, this battlefield saw one of the most significant clashes of the 19th century between the French and the Seventh Coalition.

questions.question: Which famous museum, located in Europe, introduced a pyramid glass entrance in the 1980s and houses a vast collection of art from antiquity to the 19th century?
questions.context: Home to the iconic Mona Lisa, this museum is one of the largest and most visited in the world.

questions.question: Which space exploration site in the USA has been pivotal in launching numerous manned spaceflights since its inception in the 1960s?
questions.context: This site is known for launching the Apollo 11 mission, leading to the first humans landing on the moon in 1969.
